Dear customer

Thank you for reaching out. I understand your concern regarding the inability to locate the relevant documents. After reviewing the situation, I would like to clarify that the solution you are looking for is currently not supported. You can find more details on this topic here: https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/setup-administration/supported-solutions.

Additionally, there are no specific use cases available for this solution at the moment. For further reference, you may visit the following link: https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/operations/expert-portal/setup-managed-services.html?anchorId=section0.

Best Regards,  
Sylas  
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: asset and equipment integration
entry.content:
Hi,

The asset number field does not exist in the equipment master in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, preventing the standard linking functionality . This limitation affects organizations that need to:

  • Track equipment maintenance costs against fixed assets
  • Maintain synchronized master data between PM and FI modules
  • Generate comprehensive asset reports combining operational and financial data

Please refer to the answers in Solved: Is it possible to integrate/link equipment with as... - SAP Community

Votes can be given to the CIP Equipment and Asset integration in cloud.

Also you can check the answers in Business Scenarios for Maintenance Notifications - SAP Community

Please be aware that scope item Integration with Asset Central Foundation (3YE) is in deprecation. I would not recommend you to use it. and check if the successor is in the roadmap.

 

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudo. This motivates me to serve you better.
Br.Bob

entry.title: Re: How to Use Date Management to Configure Service Contract Dates
entry.content:
Hi @Ryutaro_Koizumi,

Thanks for the comment. Sorry for replying you late. 

RoundTimeExp rounds a time to the beginning or ending of a time unit. Therefore, MONTH means a monthly rounding. When combined with the attribute "position" ("B" or "E"), the logic behaves as a monthly rounding starts ("B") or ends ("E") at the specified time.

For example, the XML code below defines a montly rounding starts with the contract start date:

<RoundTimeExp timeunit="MONTH" position="B">
   <!-- Time Expression -->
   <VarTimeExp name="CONTSTART" position="B"/>
</RoundTimeExp>

 I hope this help. Please kindly verify it with your scenarios. 

For more information, please check this blog: How to Create XML Date Rules for Service Contracts

Best Regards,

Wei

entry.title: Seeking Advice on Tools & Methodology for Legacy RFC User Permissions Cleanup
entry.content:
Hello SAP Security & Basis Experts,

We are embarking on a critical security remediation project to address over-privileged RFC users across our SAP landscape with 600+ systems. Many of these users and connections are years old, lack clear ownership, and serve various backend tasks.

Our goal is to understand what business operations each RFC user/interface actually performs and then redesign brand new ones following the principle of least privilege without disrupting genuine business processes.

There are several key challenges we meet:

1) Many RFC users were created long ago with no clear current responsible person.

2) Activities are often triggered by background jobs, making them less visible.

3) We must not miss crucial but infrequent operations (e.g., year-end financial closing), which short-term monitoring would fail to capture.

We are seeking practical advice on the following specifically:

1) Tool Recommendation: beyond native SM19/SM20 and STUSOBTRACE, what commercial or open-source tools have you successfully used for cross-system RFC user discovery, permission analysis, and activity monitoring? What are their pros/cons for this use case?

2) Methodology for business need collection: How do you practically identify the business purpose behind legacy technical RFC accounts? Are there effective techniques for correlating job schedules (SM37), interface configurations (BD64/WE20), and log data to reverse-engineer their function?

3) Capturing low-frequency activities: What is the best practice to ensure yearly/quarterly critical processes are identified? Are there technical methods to trace such execution history?

We greatly appreciate any insights, war stories, or links to useful resources you can share. Thank you for helping us!

entry.title: Custom Retry Wrapper for SAP Cloud SDK HTTP Calls
entry.content:
Custom Retry Wrapper for SAP Cloud SDK HTTP Calls

 

A Technical Justification & Deep Dive

Executive Summary

Most SAP Cloud SDK integrations rely on outbound HTTP calls to external systems. While the SDK provides built-in resilience features such as retries and circuit breakers, real-world integration scenarios often require finer control that goes beyond the default middleware.

To address these requirements, a custom utility function ‚Äî executeHttpRequestWithRetry() ‚Äî was implemented using executeHttpRequest combined with async-retry.

What This Wrapper Delivers

  • Precise control over retry behaviour

  • Per-attempt logging with full visibility

  • Business-aware retry logic (not just technical retries)

  • Clear separation of retryable vs. non-retryable responses

  • Fully consistent retry logic across all services

This document explains why this approach was required, how it aligns with SAP Cloud SDK resilience principles, and what benefits it provides.

1. Introduction

SAP Cloud SDK supports resilience patterns such as retries, timeouts, and circuit breakers. However:

These features require explicit configuration and do not cover every business scenario by default.

In complex integrations, inconsistent API behaviour and intermittent failures are common. To ensure robustness and predictable behaviour across projects, a custom retry layer was introduced.

2. Implementation Overview

2.1 Dependency

npm install async-retry

2.2 Retry Wrapper Implementation

// executeHttpRequestWithRetry.ts
import { executeHttpRequest } from '@sap-cloud-sdk/http-client';
import retry from 'async-retry';

export async function executeHttpRequestWithRetry(
  destination: any,
  requestConfig: any,
  options?: any
) {
  return retry(
    async (bail, attempt) => {
      try {
        console.log(`Attempt ${attempt} with URL: ${requestConfig?.url}`);
        return await executeHttpRequest(destination, requestConfig, options);
      } catch (error: any) {
        // Bail out if API returns misleading 2xx status with business error
        if (error?.response?.status?.toString().startsWith('2')) {
          bail(error);
        }

        console.log(`Error in attempt ${attempt}: ${error.message}`);
        throw error;
      }
    },
    {
      retries: 3
    }
  );
}

2.3 Service Usage Example

// service.ts
public async methodName(userId: string) {
  const response = await executeHttpRequestWithRetry(
    { destinationName: SF_DESTINATION_NAME },
    { method: HTTP_METHODS.GET, url: this.buildUrl(userId) },
    { fetchCsrfToken: false }
  );

  return response?.data?.d?.results?.[0] ?? null;
}

3. Why a Custom Wrapper Was Needed

(Based on SAP Cloud SDK Resilience Guidelines)

3.1 Full Control Over Retry Behaviour

SAP Cloud SDK retry middleware follows generic retry patterns. In practice, we needed:

  • A custom retry count

  • Visibility into each retry attempt

  • Explicit control over retryable vs. non-retryable errors

With the custom wrapper, logs such as:

Attempt X with URL: ...

provide full traceability, which is not available by default in the SDK.

3.2 Intelligent, Business-Aware Error Handling

Some APIs return 2xx HTTP status codes even when business logic fails (e.g., partial upserts, invalid payloads).

if (error.response.status starts with 2) bail(error);

This ensures:

  • Misleading 2xx business failures ‚Üí No retry

  • Genuine technical failures (5xx, network issues) ‚Üí Retry automatically

SAP Cloud SDK resilience middleware does not provide this level of business-aware filtering.

3.3 Consistent Retry Logic Across Microservices

SDK resilience features must be configured per client or via global providers, which can be missed or misconfigured.

The wrapper guarantees:

  • Identical retry behaviour

  • Uniform error handling

  • Standardised logging

  • Consistent retry count

across the entire codebase, regardless of which team or developer implements a module.

3.4 Simplified Developer Experience

Instead of configuring resilience for every outbound request, developers simply call:

executeHttpRequestWithRetry(...)

This approach:

  • Reduces configuration mistakes

  • Improves maintainability

  • Ensures predictable behaviour

  • Hides resilience complexity from application developers

3.5 Improved Observability

The wrapper explicitly logs:

  • Each retry attempt

  • Target URL

  • Error messages per attempt

SDK default logging often abstracts retry internals unless advanced logging is enabled.

3.6 Future-Proof Design

Using async-retry enables easy future enhancements:

  • Exponential backoff

  • Custom retry delays

  • Conditional retries (e.g., HTTP 429 throttling)

  • Telemetry and monitoring hooks

These enhancements are significantly easier to implement with a custom retry abstraction.

4. Comparison: Custom Wrapper vs. SAP Cloud SDK Defaults

Aspect SAP Cloud SDK (Generic) Custom Wrapper (async-retry)

Retry Status HandlingGeneric, limited customizationExplicit control over 5xx, 429, network errors; fail-fast on 4xx
ObservabilityRetry logic mostly hiddenPer-attempt logging with full transparency
IdempotencyLimited method-level controlEnforced idempotency, with override options
Backoff & JitterFixed defaultsFully configurable (min/max timeout, factor, randomization)

5. Retry Flow (Conceptual)

Request ‚Üí Attempt 1 ‚Üí Success ‚Üí Return

‚§∑ Failure ‚Üí Retry Decision ‚Üí Attempt 2 ‚Üí ... ‚Üí Max Retries ‚Üí Fail or Bail

6. Benefits Summary

Benefit Description

Per-attempt loggingComplete visibility into retry behaviour
Business-aware retriesPrevents retries on misleading 2xx responses
Consistent behaviourUniform logic across services
Simple developer usageOne function call, no configuration
FlexibilityEasy extension for throttling and backoff
Easier debuggingClear insights into API instability

7. Conclusion

While SAP Cloud SDK provides a strong resilience foundation, real-world enterprise integrations demand deeper control and transparency.

The custom executeHttpRequestWithRetry wrapper successfully extends SDK capabilities by delivering:

  • Predictable and consistent retry logic

  • Business-aware error handling

  • High observability

  • Simplified developer experience

  • Flexibility for future enhancements

This approach ensures reliable, maintainable, and production-grade integrations across all SAP Cloud SDK-based services.

entry.title: Can we extract Course Completion Certificate via API in SAP SuccessFactors LMS?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I would like to understand whether it is possible to extract or download Course Completion Certificates via API in SAP SuccessFactors LMS.

Business Requirement:

When a user completes a course, a Certificate of Completion is generated in LMS.

We want to fetch this certificate (PDF or file format) using an API and integrate it with an external system.

Questions:

Is there any standard LMS API or OData API available to download completion certificates?

Can certificates be accessed via Plateau Web Services (SOAP APIs) or any other integration method?

If direct extraction is not supported, what are the recommended alternatives (e.g., document management, custom solution, report-based approach)?

Any guidance, documentation references, or real-time implementation experience would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.content:

@SAP/hdb-project:app generator failed - env.on(error) The generator encountered an error: Error: Failed to create the service "Project1-hdidb-ws-mbr10"; Reason: Job (028ce850-2fe1-4ac8-8b6c-b907c5a93659) failed: provision could not be completed: Service broker error: Service broker hana-broker failed with: Can not create service instance 'Project1-hdidb-ws-mbr10': There is no database available. What I have done so far:

Despite these steps, I am still receiving the same error. Could anyone help me understand what might be causing this issue or suggest steps to resolve it?

Thank you in advance for your support!

entry.title: Re: Custom verification logic for RF transaction in Public Cloud WM
entry.content:
Hello

I assume you were asking RF logic transaction "05 Internal Processes -> 02 Adhoc WT Creation -> 01 Replenishment for Fixed Bin". Cloud WM didn't provide replenishment for inbound on RF devices. If it's "Replenishment for Fixed Bin" you were asking, it doesn't provide supplier on screen but it provides product for input/scan. No standard functionality to support your requirement. 

Maybe you may try to enhance the transaction by "PERSONAS" . By PERSONAS , it's allowed to customize local logic via JAVA script. Search and find valid API for supplier and then call this suitable API in your enhanced script program (Detail please refer to the SAP provided guide book for personas).  For example you input a barcode string including supplier product quantity in the input box of product on RF screen , the barcode string could be handled and checked first in your enhanced PERSONAS script. Script re-set the input box value by valid product number finally. The correct product number will be transport to SAP standard program. 

Regards,

ZZ

entry.title: Re: Streamline Your SAP Cloud ERP Private Upgrades with the New Release Upgrade Management Applicati
entry.content:
Why is Release Upgrade Manager not part of SAP Cloud ALM?

Planning, tasks, timelines, and responsibilities are already there. Testing, monitoring, readiness checks, and quality gates are also part of everyday life in Cloud ALM.

An upgrade is not an isolated technical event, but a lifecycle issue ‚Äì involving preparation, follow-up work, and operational impacts. That's exactly what Cloud ALM is designed for. An integrated approach would not only reduce the number of tools, but also create true consistency.

Are there any plans in this regard?

PS: Perhaps it is generally unfortunate to use abbreviations that stand for completely different topics in the same context area (Lifecycle Management) ‚Äì especially in an environment where monitoring, upgrades, and ALM are closely intertwined anyway:

RUM = Release Upgrade Management
RUM = Real User Monitoring

entry.title: Re: Archiving of Onboarding Tasks is not working
entry.content:
@LauraUreno Please find below possible causes:I verified your configurations provided and looks good.

1.Does compliance step exist for candidate ? if yes and it is open - then archive will not function properly for candidates whose compliance process is still open.

Solution: Make ensure compliance process is completed.

2.Offboarding Disablement :Offboarding was enabled in the system at one point and Later it was disabled

In this period some offboarding processes were created and now job is failing as offboarding is not enabled and it is trying to archive the offboarding processes

Solution :Make ensure to close open offboarding process OR alternative enable offboarding again in provisioning temporarily so job can archive the processes

if above suggestions does not help and based on your statement post script run ,whole functionality is not working as expected:I would suggest you to open a support ticket and check backend logs why your instance archive job is not functioning properly .

Thanks,

Gopi

entry.title: Re: POST Request Working in Postman but Failing in CPI Wi...
entry.content:
Thanks a lot to @Ryan-Crosby  for pointing out the difference in CSRF token handling. That insight made me dig deeper into how CPI processes response headers.

Here‚Äôs what worked for me:

  • The key was to read the CSRF token and cookies from CamelHttpResponseHeaders after the GET call instead of relying on normal headers.
  • I stored them as Exchange Properties and reused them for the POST request.
  • Also enabled HTTP Session Reuse = On Exchange in the iFlow runtime configuration to maintain the same session.
  • Finally, set the POST headers:
    • X-CSRF-Token = ${property.csrfToken}
    • Cookie = built from Set-Cookie values.

After applying this, the POST request returned 201 Created successfully.

Thanks again for the guidance‚Äîit helped me find the right approach!

entry.title: Re: Report on the characteristics entered in the batches.
entry.content: Hi Angel, There is no list report for characristics value of class (for batch) in Public cloud ERP. You may need to create a custom query by using below CDS views. 1. CDS for Characteristic Characteristic Header: I_ClfnCharacteristicForKeyDate Characteristic Description: I_ClfnCharcDescForKeyDate Characteristic Value: I_ClfnCharcValueForKeyDate Characteristic Value Description: I_ClfnCharcValueDescForKeyDate 2. CDS for Class Class Header: I_ClfnClassForKeyDate Class Description: I_ClfnClassDescForKeyDate Class Keyword: I_ClfnClassKeywordForKeyDate Class Characteristic: I_ClfnClassCharcForKeyDate 3. Object Classification Characteristic Valuation: I_ClfnObjectCharcValForKeyDate Class Assignment: I_ClfnObjectClassForKeyDate

entry.title: Inquiry about how to use the EXECUTE_UPDATE method of the CL_SQL_PREPARED_STATEMENT class
entry.content:
We used the CL_SQL_CONNECTION, CL_SQL_PREPARED_STATEMENT, and CL_SQL_STATEMENT classes in an ABAP program for data DELETE & INSERT processing to a specific Oracle DB. (ADBC)

 

However, we discovered that, perhaps because mass data was transmitted, the requested data deletion/insertion does not work. ( Partially, deleted / input was processed. )

 

First, using‚ÄØCL_SQL_CONNECTION->PREPARE_STATEMENT()‚ÄØwe defined the SQL.
(Ex)‚ÄØDELETE‚ÄØFROM‚ÄØ...‚ÄØWHERE‚ÄØA‚ÄØ=‚ÄØ?‚ÄØand‚ÄØB‚ÄØ=‚ÄØ?‚ÄØ.... )

Then, using‚ÄØCL_SQL_PREPARED_STATEMENT->SET_PARAM_TABLE(),‚ÄØwe set the data.

Finally, we called‚ÄØCL_SQL_PREPARED_STATEMENT->EXECUTE_UPDATE().

 

However, we discovered that the intended number of DELETE/INSERT operations were not being processed.

 

When I reduced the number of transmissions, I confirmed that it operates normally.

How can we determine an appropriate size(SET_PARAM_TABLE),

and could you provide any guide documents or sample programs?

entry.title: Onboarding not initiating for International transfer
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are facing an issue in which Onboarding is not initiating for Employee's international transfer. The user is transferring from Brazil to NLD. In BPE, it is giving the following error:

jobInfo : The country of the work schedule BRA_WS13 does not match the country/region for the selected company. Please choose a global work schedule or one whose country/region matches the country/region for the selected company., There is already a hire record for user. You cannot create another hire record if one already exists., You cannot create a job information record for user  before the effective start date in the hire record., It is not permitted due to your system configuration to process this transfer. To perform the transfer, please terminate this record and then rehire with new employment, HIRINTL for Object eventReason is not a consistent value with the associated Object Country/Region with value NLD

Note: We have replicated the exact scenario in our Dev Instance for same user, and we were able to successfully initiate the international transfer without any issues. (Also, we have not mapped work schedule in recruit to hire data mapping in both prod and UAT)

Please let me know if anyone faced this issue earlier.

SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding

entry.title: Re: S-User extend activation
entry.content:
Hello customer,

In order to extend your S-user validity, I would like to draw your attention that the Expiry Date (expiration date) of regular S-user IDs can only be managed by Super, Cloud, and User Administrators in the User Management application.

To check your company's super user, cloud admins or user admins kindly visit My Important Contacts page.

Then kindly contact your super user, cloud admins or user admins to extend your user validity as per the detailed steps introduced in KBA https://me.sap.com/notes/2930885.

You cannot edit or extend the validity date of your S-user by yourself.

Hope the above information helps.

Thanks and regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: URL routing for CAP apps across BTP subaccounts without workzone
entry.content:
We have a three-tier SAP BTP landscape (BTP_DEV, BTP_QAS, BTP_PROD) with a few CAP-based applications. In parallel, we operate an embedded Fiori Launchpad on our OnPrem system that is also structured in three environments (DEV, QAS, PROD).

Current Situation:

  • CAP apps in the Fiori Launchpad are linked via URL tiles
  • Unfortunately each app in every BTP subaccount has its own unique URL (no subdomain-based routing pattern like dev.apps.btp.com/app1, qas.apps.btp.com/app1
  • All CAP apps have the same name across subaccounts like app1, app2 etc

Requirement: We need a solution to ensure that:

  • The Fiori DEV Launchpad points to CAP Apps in BTP_DEV
  • The Fiori QAS Launchpad points to CAP Apps in BTP_QAS
  • The Fiori PROD Launchpad points to CAP Apps in BTP_PROD

Current Challenge: Since each BTP subaccount generates unique URLs for the same app, we cannot simply use static URLs in the tiles or use a system alias for each enviroonment. We need a dynamic routing mechanism.

What is the recommended approach, if workzone is unfortunately no possibility?
Is there a BTP side url mapping? Would a custom backend service with a customizing table with the CAP app urls be a better approach? Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Positioning SAP Business Data Cloud with SAP Snowflake
entry.content:
Your customers want AI-ready SAP data.  They don‚Äôt want more pipelines, copies, or complexity.

Join our webinar, ‚ÄúPositioning SAP Business Data Cloud with SAP Snowflake,‚Äù to see how SAP Snowflake and SAP BDC connect for SAP Snowflake unlock zero-copy, bidirectional data sharing with Snowflake‚Äôs AI data cloud.

In one focused session, you‚Äôll learn how to:

  • Position SAP Snowflake and SAP BDC connect in exec-level conversations
  • Explain the architecture and integrations in minutes, not slides
  • Navigate the pricing structure so deals move faster
  • Use partner resources to accelerate your next SAP + Snowflake engagement

You‚Äôll also see a concrete demo of SAP BDC connect for SAP Snowflake in the SAP business data fabric‚Äîso you can picture exactly how this lands in your customer‚Äôs landscape.

If you‚Äôre ready to turn ‚ÄúSAP + AI‚Äù from buzzwords into a clear value story, Register now  https://partneredge.sap.com/en/library/education/psd/2025/dec/e_oe_te_w_PSD_WEB_00012365.html

#SAP #SAPBTP #SAPPartners #SAPSnowflake #SAPBDC #ModernDataStack #AIWithSAP

entry.title: Re: Enhancements‚ÄØto‚ÄØCustom CDS Views‚ÄØCreated‚ÄØBased on‚ÄØC-1 Released‚ÄØI_ProjectBillingElement View
entry.content:
Hi @Paul_Richert 

Thank you for your query.

To find out whether you have created custom CDS views based on the I_ProjectBillingElement view, you need to follow these steps:

  1. Open the I_ProjectBillingElement CDS view in Eclipse/ABAP Development Tools (ADT) and check the Where-Used list.

     


  2. From the Object Type list, select Data Definition.




    A list of CDS views you have created based on the I_ProjectBillingElement CDS view will appear. The names of custom CDS views mostly start with YY1*.

    Hope this helps!
    Thank you!

entry.title: houstkeeping the tables , the Data Volume Size/Disk Size still the same
entry.content:
Currently, I am facing an issue regarding database storage.. We have identified data redundancy in some of the database tables and wish to clean up this portion of the data. 

before the junk data was wrote to the table CDPOS and DBTABLOG, the Data Volume Size/Disk Size is 367.33/674.65 , after wrote the junk data is 738.56/974.66. After the housekeeping , the table size already decrease .

My question is: after housekeeping the data, why in DB50 the Data Volume Size/Disk Size still the same(AFTER), but actual the tables size already decrease. How can the system Data Volume Size/Disk Size restore back?

entry.title: Re: TDS Limit in SAP Based on total invoice amount for fi...
entry.content:
Yes configuration alone won‚Äôt solve cumulative PAN-level validation and below would be my suggested approach

  • Fetch Vendor PAN from LFA1-J_1IPANNO.
  • Get all Vendor Codes linked to that PAN.
  • Read Invoice Amounts:
    • If ECC: Use BSIK (open items) + BSAS (cleared items).
    • If S/4HANA: Use ACDOCA.
  • Aggregate cumulative value for the fiscal year (April‚ÄìMarch).
  • Check threshold:
    • If cumulative < ‚Çπ50,00,000 ‚Üí No TDS.
    • If cumulative ‚â• ‚Çπ50,00,000 ‚Üí Apply TDS via enhancement.
  • Enhancement Spot:
    • Typically in BADI / User Exit during MIRO (invoice posting) or F-43 (vendor invoice).
    • Example: BADI_FDCB_SUBBAS01 or RFWT0010 (Withholding Tax exits).

entry.title: Re: Moving Dimension Comment to the far right of my table...
entry.content:
@nlrkg 

I think since dimension comments are bound with visible dimensions on the table, its positions as the first column of the axes of column and row dimension intersection. I don't think its possible to re position it but if you see dimension comment creates a formula like below. May be you could try inserting a empty column manually at end at placing the formula which gets created by inserting the dimension comment. Mostly it would not work but worth giving it a try.

=DIMCOMMENT([D/ENTITY],[D/PRODUCT],[D/ACCOUNT])

Hope this helps !

Nikhil

entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am facing an issue with WIND entries related to document category 55 for POS outbound. These entries are being deleted daily, and I suspect this is caused by the report RWDPOSRS_OLD, which we have scheduled to run daily.

I understand that RWDPOSRS_OLD deletes WIND entries, but I am not sure how the program decides which entries to delete. Has anyone experienced this issue or can provide insights on how to determine if and why the doc category 55 entries are being deleted?

Thank you in advance for your support!

entry.title: How to retrieve open AR items including partial payments in Custom CDS View (same as F0711)?
entry.content:
Title:
How to retrieve open AR items including partial payments in Custom CDS View (same as F0711)?
Body:
Objective:
I need to create a custom CDS view that retrieves the same open AR line items as the standard Fiori app F0711 (Manage Customer Line Items) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
Current Situation:
I'm using I_JournalEntryOperationalView as the primary data source with the following WHERE clause:


ClearingDate = '00000000'
AND IsOpenItemManaged = 'X'
AND (AccountingDocumentType = 'RV'
OR AccountingDocumentType = 'DR')
```

**Problem:**
This condition works for most cases, but **it excludes items with partial payments**. When a partial payment is posted, the `ClearingDate` field gets populated (e.g., '20230713'), even though the item still has an outstanding balance.

**Example:**
- Journal Entry: 1800000000
- Line Item: 000001
- `ClearingDate`: '20230713' (not '00000000')
- `IsOpenItemManaged`: 'X'
- Status in F0711: **Open (Clearing Status = 2)**
- Status in my CDS View: **Excluded** (due to ClearingDate filter)

**Question:**
Which field(s) should I use to correctly identify open items including partially cleared items, matching the logic of F0711?

I've tried:
- `ClearingJournalEntry` (empty check)
- `ClearingAccountingDocument` (empty check)
- `ReceivableFinancingStatus` (not populated in our system)

**Additional Info:**
- System: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
- Data Source: `I_JournalEntryOperationalView`
- Fiori App: F0711 - Manage Customer Line Items

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Re: How to trigger custom logic after F-44 clearing document is posted (BTE/BAdI/User-Exit)?
entry.content: Have you checked whether a Workflow Event is raised when the document is posted? Activate Workflow Event logging in transaction SWELS, then post a document using F-44. Afterwards, check which Events were triggered in transaction SWEL. If there is a suitable event, then you can use this as your hook. Set up an Event Linkage using transaction SWE2 and a function module can be called after the Accounting Document is posted and committed.

entry.title: Re: Onboarding not initiating for International transfer
entry.content:
Hi Gopinath

This issue is for a single user and upon further analysis we found that this error is coming because the business team have initiated international transfer (Onboarding) for the user without terminating the user from existing LE.

And now, they have terminated the user (Future dated termination) and also set the Start date for NLD (Start date> Term date).

But still BPE tile is showing this error. Please let us know how we can fix this issue.

entry.title: Re: SAPUI5 Rich Text Editor Custom File & Image Upload Handler
entry.content:
Hi @js2,

I don't think such extensions would be supported on the macro building blocks. Upon checking the API reference of the  BuildingBlock there seems to be no event available for the BeforeEditorInit available for the control. Hence, I believe we wont be able to customise the TinyMCE initialisation at the first place.

Please let me know if you find any updates regarding the same.

entry.content: Is it possible in SAP BW CompositeProviders to model a join scenario within a single CompositeProvider where data provider 1 and data provider 2 are joined using WBS TOP (non time-dependent), while data provider 2 and data provider 3 are joined using Fiscal Year (time-dependent)?

entry.title: SAP J4C Application & benefits in Implementation projects
entry.content:
*Quantifiable benefits described in numbers below are purely based on my project experience & may change based on type of project (Conversion/Greenfield/brownfield), size of project, number of modules implemented & other variables. These are not official numbers prescribed by SAP.

Introduction

The objective of this blog is to cover, how SAP J4C addresses challenges faced by project team in an SAP S/4 HANA private cloud implementation and generate quantifiable benefits. The illustration is strictly based on activate methodology & quantitative benefits are described per SAP Activate phase.  Following personas and SAP activate tasks are considered for illustration purpose and may change based on project. Sample prompts are added to address real-time problems encountered during implementation.

  • SAP Activate Project Manager
  • Functional & Technical architect
  • Business process functional consultant
  • Project Lead
  • Test Manager

Boundary considerations

The SAP Activate methodology is the backbone of every S/4HANA project as considered as implementation methodology. It defines what needs to be done, when, and by whom. This blog is not aimed to explain Activate Methodology, Solution neither business process scenario like procure to pay, hire to retire. Below analysis is limited to SAP S/4HANA private cloud, to provide a structure how to leverage SAP J4C in SAP S/4HANA private cloud greenfield implementation. Used J45 & 19J best practice scope item just as an example to fire prompt & for illustration perspective. On a project management journey, it may be required to fragment prompts due to words limit of output.

Why J4C

Let us start with highlighting day to day challenges, faced by SAP project team:

  • High dependency on SME
  • Long analysis cycles
  • Repetitive tasks
  • Delays in clarifications
  • Knowledge gaps across modules
  • Slow decision-making
  • Heavy documentation load
  • Manual effort in design, testing & cutover planning

This is where SAP J4C can act as force multiplier at address above challenges.

Why & when to use J4C

Below is the SAP Activate phase-by-phase benefit illustration of SAP J4C & quantifiable impact in terms of saving time, effort & quality of deliverables.

Discover Phase

Discover phase sets the foundation for the entire SAP program, SAP J4C supplements appropriate solution positioning, improves value assessment & organize fragmented customer inputs to drive base scope. SAP J4C is instrumental in translating business language into SAP process language to freeze scope.

Activate Task

Sample prompts

Output & KPIs

Pre-sales & Sales partners is expected to present ‚Äì Business case for SAP S/4HANA product & implementation with ROI models, net present value, payback period scenarios to customer.

Customer is evaluating SAP S/4HANA as ERP solution and implement SAP S/4HANA private cloud. to back up implementation business decision, make a business case and illustrate ROI models, net present value, payback period scenarios.

¬∑         Present ROI tree

¬∑         Scenario Analysis - (Conservative/Base/Optimistic scenario)

¬∑         Risk Assessment & Mitigation, Sensitivity Analysis

¬∑         Implementation timelines & milestones with duration

Resulting in 20‚Äì30% faster business case creation.

Pre-sales & Sales partners to perform value Assessments and suggests industry KPIs, benchmarking stats, SAP industry value drivers

 

Justify value drivers of SAP S/4 HANA in explore phase by performing industry level benchmarking with facts & figure and potential SAP value drivers. Please keep above context & co-relate your output while performing industry benchmarking.

 

¬∑         Industry benchmarking of current state Industry Analysis (Legacy System Performance Metrics vs Digital Transformation Maturity)

¬∑         S/4HANA Value Driver Analysis

(Core Value Drivers with Industry Benchmarks, Technology Performance Gains, Industry-Specific Value Drivers)

¬∑         Financial Impact Benchmarking (Industry ROI Patterns, Cost Structure Benchmarks)

¬∑         Risk-Adjusted Value Assessment

20% more aligned value assessment report with SAP Best Practices

Pre-sales & Sales partners to generates transformation scenario roadmaps (Big Bang Vs Phased Rollout Vs Hybrid Coexistence Model) with dependencies for SAP S/4 HANA private cloud implementation

Generate transformation roadmap for S/4 HANA private cloud considering multiple scenario roadmaps with dependencies and pros & cons of each transformation journey for S/4 HANA private cloud implementation

 

¬∑         Transformation Framework Overview

¬∑         Scenario Analysis (Big Bang Vs Phased Rollout Vs Hybrid Coexistence Model) with Approach Overview

¬∑         Dependencies/ Pros & Cons of approaches Analysis

¬∑         Sample implementation plan with timelines

30% faster decision making in terms of decision (Big Bang Vs Phases Vs hybrid implementation approach)

 

Prepare Phase

SAP Joule for Consultants (J4C) Accelerates translation of vision defined in discover phase into execution readiness. SAP J4C crystalizes project plan, defines clear ownership and establishes alignment on landscape, test, data, and integration strategies.

Activate Task

Sample prompts

Output & KPIs

Project Manager need to create a project plan WBS Structure preferably to auto-populate task from SAP Activate methodology.

The project implementation is currently in SAP Activate prepare phase of S/4HANA private cloud implementation. It is required to create a project plan to govern & track WBS task. Please generate a project plan with work break down structure containing SAP Activate task along with columns to capture timelines, effort, role and dependencies.

¬∑         SAP Activate Project WBS Template

With provision to capture timelines/effort/role/dependencies of all Activate Task.

¬∑         Highlight risk & dependency.

Note ‚Äì For CALM customers, project plan WBS structure is available & is based on type of project selected.

 

 

 

 

20% faster project plan creation with WBS.

Project team may need project kick-off deck, with defined scope, timelines & resource loading.

, SSB and governance model

As part of S/4HANA private cloud implementation a project manager is expected to create kick-off slides, List down important content to be added in kick-off deck.

¬∑         List important content to be added in kick-off deck.

Note: Directs user to SAP process navigator where Activate project kick-off slides are added as accelerator.

 

Reduces PM effort in prepare phase by 10%

Project manager also needs to outline assignment of task with appropriate RACI, RAID and establish a Communication Plan

 

A project manager intent to create communication plan during prepare phase of S/4HANA private cloud implementation. As part of the communication plan, it is important to clearly highlight RACI matrix involving all personas defined in activate methodology.

¬∑         Draft communication plan derived by SAP Activate methodology.

¬∑         RACI matrix for stakeholder management

 

 

20% reduction in building communication plan.

Project Manager, Solution Lead, Functional Consultant to make Fit to Workshops schedule with clear agenda, questionnaires, slides, demo scripts

For an SAP S/4HANA private implementation with following scenarios in scope Order-to-Cash (O2C), Procure-to-Pay (P2P) , Plan-to-Produce (PP) Manufacturing Process Record-to-Report (R2R) Finance Process Hire-to-Retire (H2R) HR Process Forecast-to-Fulfil Process Acquire-to-Retire (A2R) Asset Management Project-to-Delivery (P2D) Project Management I want to conduct fit to standard work, can you please create a workshop invite template with following details date & duration, scope items, short business benefits of scope items, Attendees in a tabular structure.

 

¬∑         Workshop template, overview & schedule

¬∑         Process Scope & Business Benefits of SAP best practice scope item.

 

20% improvement in consultant prep-work & focussed workshop structure

A technical architect to define customer landscape strategy including system infrastructure, environmental system composition etc.

 

A technical consultant/SAP basis consultant is expected to design system landscape strategy, sizing in for S/4 HANA private cloud implementation. List down activities to be part of system landscape strategy document along with Ariba used for procurement and sourcing, concur for travel & expense management.

 

¬∑         Infrastructure Requirements Definition (CPU cores/Memory/Storage)

¬∑         System Requirements Matrix

¬∑         Environment Management Strategy

¬∑         Performance & Monitoring Strategy

(CPU utilization threshold, Annual growth projections)

¬∑         Disaster Recovery & Business Continuity

¬∑         Security & Compliance Framework

 

20% faster landscape planning.

Integration architects need to define system Integration Strategy of SAP & non-sap system in customer landscape.

 

 

 

 

 

An integration consultant/SAP BTP consultant is expected to design system integration strategy for S/4 HANA private cloud implementation. List down activities to be part of system integration strategy document along with Ariba used for procurement and sourcing, concur for travel & expense management.

 

¬∑         Integration plan overview (Objective, Scope, Integration Principles)

¬∑         Integration Landscape Assessment (Real-time API, Batch, Real-time)

¬∑         Integration Architecture Design

(Event Mesh, REST APIs, SFTP with transformation)

¬∑         Integration Design Ex - S/4HANA to Ariba & Concur

¬∑         SAP BTP Integration Platform Configuration

¬∑         Suggests integration patterns (AIF, BTP, CPI)

¬∑         Data Transformation & Mapping

 

10‚Äì15% drop in integration design strategy

Creates ETL approach document with data migration plan and executive summary (scope, approach & success criteria)

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

A data migration consultant is looking to draft data migration strategy at various implementation of phase of SAP S/4HANA private cloud implementation. List down activities to be part of system data migration plan document for S/4 HANA private implementation including ETL, load waves & cutover design of sandbox, development & quality system.

¬∑         Migration Strategy Definition (Legacy System data Inventory)

¬∑         ETL Tool Evaluation (SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit, SAP Data Services, Custom ABAP/BDC)

¬∑         Data Analysis, Preparation and

Load Wave Design (Wave ‚Äì 1 Master data, Wave 2 ‚Äì Configuration data, Wave 3 ‚Äì Open Tx Wave 4 - Historical Transactions)

 

Win rate of 40% for data migration clarity

Apart from above highlighted deliverables, SAP Joule for consultant can be useful in drafting templates for RAID log, Project charter & change management & security role design strategy.

Explore Phase

SAP J4C facilitate functional consultant in performing Fit-to-Standard workshops, Business process mapping, Requirements capture & deltas, Backlog creation, Solution design & architecture. It also helps in creation of functional specs & interface specs and chalk out Integration, data, security design. This is the most documentation-heavy phase‚Äîand SAP J4C provides massive acceleration.

Activate Task

Sample prompts

Output & KPIs

SAP Functional Consultant need to do fit-to-standard preparation before a workshop.

SAP functional consultant is planning to conduct fit to standard workshop during explore phase for SAP S/4HANA private cloud implementation. As part of fit to standard workshop preparation consultant needs pre-read of solution scope, solution specific questionnaire, create backlog template etc. before actual fit-to-standard workshop during explore phase.

 

 

Prompt 2 - A functional consultant is planning to conduct fit to standard workshop during explore phase for SAP S/4HANA private cloud implementation. As part of fit to standard workshop preparation consultant needs pre-read of procurement & sourcing SAP best practice scope J45 & 19J. Generate pre-reads document for J45 & 19J.

¬∑         Generates pre-read documents. (Business process description, standard process flow, pre-requisites (master data, configuration data etc.), Integration & process dependencies between J45 & 19J

¬∑         Refer to process-level questions as accelerator as part Activate methodology.

¬∑         Backlog item template

 

30% reduction in workshop preparation time, 70-80% completeness in requirement coverage and zero duplication of backlog items

Post fit-to-standard functional consultant is expected to draft user stories based on workshop discussion with customer assuming workshop is recorded & meeting text transcript is available.

Fit to standard workshop is recorded & converted to below text transcript, as a next step functional consultant is expected to create user stories in the format ‚ÄúAs an SAP Personas, I want to perform task to achieve process improvement KPI.‚Äù Create user stories from below text script of fit to standard workshop of SAP S/4 HANA requisitioning process. ""Text Transcript""

 

¬∑         Automation of User Story generation

¬∑         Based on fit-to-standard workshop text transcripts.

¬∑         Generate User stories in customer specific format like ‚ÄúAs an SAP Personas, I want to perform task to achieve process improvement KPI.‚Äù

¬∑         Propose Acceptance criteria per user story.

¬∑         Next Steps proposals

 

20% faster user story creation with high adherence to customer user story template.

Next logical step is to automate creation of a functional specification based on logically linked user stories.

 

 

Based on user stories 1, 3, & 4 create functional specifications segregate them based on type of WRICEF objects

 

¬∑         Produce first cut of RICEFW functional specs.

¬∑         Generate interface mapping tables

¬∑         Suggest WRICEF complexity level (High/Med/Low)

¬∑         Create test cases linked to requirement IDs

¬∑         Generate pseudo code / flow charts for developers

20% faster functional spec writing & 25% fewer developer clarifications resulting in 15% reduction in rework cycle time

Supporting documents (Coding standards, Error/Exception handling)

Prompt 1 - Create technical ABAP naming convention document for all ABAP objects like class, reports etc. to make sure developers adhere to naming convention.

 

¬∑         Naming convention document

¬∑         Exception Handling Framework (Runtime/Validation/Authorization Errors) for WRICEF developments.

¬∑         SAP BTP vs CPI vs API Hub recommendations

 

Realize Phase ‚Äì Build, Test & Validate Faster

SAP Joule for Consultants (J4C) streamlines configuration and development by guiding consultants with SAP Best Practices‚Äìaligned setups and standard extensibility patterns, reducing rework and over-customization. It accelerates unit testing, SIT, and UAT preparation by generating test scenarios, validating process coverage, and ensuring traceability from Fit-to-Standard decisions to test cases.

Activate Task

Sample prompts

Output & KPIs

Functional consultant needs configuration guidance to setup system based on customer requirements.

SAP materials management functional consultant plan to start system configuration in development system for S/4 HANA private implementation. List important steps to kickstart system configuration in SAP MM module.

 

¬∑         Pre-Configuration Prerequisites

¬∑         Organizational Structure Setup

¬∑         Master Data Configuration

¬∑         Procurement Process Configuration

¬∑         Inventory Management Setup

¬∑         Invoice Verification Configuration & Integration Points

10‚Äì15% faster system configuration.

Functional consultant to write Functional specification & technical consultant to realize requirements with TS & development support

Requirement specific Prompt*

¬∑         Guide ABAP class, CDS Views, workflow events, BTP event Mesh patterns, OData service structure & enhancement exits, BADIs

¬∑         Draft functional specs with above inputs

¬∑         WRICEF complexity classification (High/Med/Low)

KPI

¬∑         20% fewer defects in unit testing

¬∑         20% reduction in development effort

¬∑         40% faster functional spec writing

¬∑         25% fewer developer clarifications

¬∑         15% reduction in rework cycle time

Test Case generation from user stories.

Create a test script based on user stories highlighted below

‚Äú‚Äù As a Requisitioner, I want to add "Stage of Material" as a custom field in purchase requisitions & perform validation against values maintained in material master attributes. So that additional product attributes are captured enabling 100% material classification accuracy and improved supplier selection‚Äù‚Äù

 

¬∑         Auto-generate test scripts from user stories

¬∑         Create SIT & UAT readiness reports

 

20% to 30 reductions in test-case creation time and Reduce UAT sign-off time (20‚Äì30%)

               

 

Clean core guidance

Check below code follows clean core principles

¬∑         Higher Clean core adherence

¬∑         Save upgrade cost

 

 

Deploy & Run phase ‚Äì Optimize Cutover, Handover & Go-Live

J4C supports data migration, OCM, and cutover by structuring migration objects, sequencing activities, and aligning change impacts and readiness go-live checklists with Activate milestones. Finally, it simplifies documentation and training creation by auto-structuring role-based content directly from approved SAP processes and solution designs. Key Activate Tasks being facilitated by J4C during run phase Hypercare readiness, Handover to support & Production validation

Activate Task

Sample prompts

Output & KPIs

Cutover manager must prepare a cutover Plan containing task during deployment phase.

As part of cut-over & SAP activate deploy phase activities for SAP private cloud implementation, List down tasks, sequence task & assign ownership considering deployment duration is 3 days.

¬∑         Draft cutover plan by workstream (MM/FI/Technical etc.)

¬∑         Outlines inter dependencies

¬∑         Draft hourly go-live activity list

¬∑          Clear task sequencing

30% reduction in drafting cutover plan

Run phase preparation

Future release adoption,

Training & user support

Monitoring & optimization

 

For the SAP private cloud implementation postproduction go-live, generate SOP template, Incidence tracking report, SLA‚Äôs template for incidences tracking & assignment.

¬∑         Draft SOP

¬∑         Incident creation template

¬∑         Draft SLAs for incidences

¬∑         Draft Weekly/Daily status reports

 

25‚Äì30% faster ticket resolution and future ready for upcoming releases & innovations

Impact Summary

SAP Personas

SAP J4C Impact area

Quantitative Benefits

Functional Consultant

Fit-to-standard, specs, test scripts

15‚Äì20% effort reduction

Technical Consultant / ABAP

Code patterns, CDS/OData, unit tests

10‚Äì20% fewer defects

Technical/Integration Architect

E2E design, integration patterns

5‚Äì10% architecture consistency boost

Project Manager

WBS, RAID, governance, PMO artifacts

Saves 8‚Äì12 hours/week

Basis / Security

Sizing summaries, role mapping, cutover prep

15% faster planning cycles

Data Lead

Mapping templates, validation rules

Up to 50% faster prep

OCM Lead

Training docs, FAQs, communication

20‚Äì30% faster doc creation

 

Conclusion: Why every SAP project must use SAP J4C

SAP J4C is not a replacement for SAP consulting fraternity‚Äîit is an amplifier. It reduces manual documentation, accelerates analysis, enhances solution quality, and frees consultants to focus on client advisory rather than repetitive tasks.

By embedding SAP J4C into every SAP Activate phase, organizations gain a measurable competitive advantage‚Äîshorter timelines, improved quality, and smoother delivery.

entry.title: Croatia billing/posting date vs creation/issue date #COE#SW01
entry.content:
S4Hana Public Cloud 2508 2SL. Due to Croatia Fiscalization 2.0 "The invoice date must match the XML submission date, meaning both occur on the same calendar day" 

When issuing billing documents in January 2026 some have the service rendered/delivery date in December 2025. Last year wasn't a problem because we didn't have fiscalization. We issued invoices in January 2025 with the billing date and service rendered date 31.12.2024. This accounted for the revenue and VAT in tax year 2024.

If the invoice date must be the same as the issue date (January 2026) then the journal entry date and posting date will also be January 2026. This means the revenue and VAT get recognized in 2026, but our accountants say it must be posted to the output invoice book (I-RA) for December. VAT is reported in the VAT form for December Tax Administration.

How can we issue an invoice in January 2026 with January 2026 billing date, but posting date 2025 so the VAT is accounted for in the previous year/period?

entry.title: Re: SAP Event Mesh
entry.content: You need to purchase a separate license to use the SAP Event Mesh service.

entry.title: Calculating surcharges on contract manufacturing
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to calculate a material with surcharges that has a contract manufacturing component. The value is taken from an info record for the calculation. The material has the special procurement key 30. When I calculate now, no surcharges are determined. If I remove Sobsl 30, surcharges are calculated, but subcontracting is no longer taken into account.

Does anyone have any idea why this might be?

entry.title: Re: Croatia billing/posting date vs creation/issue date #...
entry.content:
Since configuration alone cannot override fiscalization rules, you need to handle this via accounting processes:

1. Accruals / Period-End Adjustments
Post manual accruals in December 2025 for revenue and VAT related to services rendered in December. Use period-end closing activities (accrual engine or manual journal entries). This ensures VAT is reported in December‚Äôs VAT return, even though the invoice is issued in January.

2. Advance Billing / Proforma
Issue a December proforma or advance invoice (non-fiscalized) to record VAT and revenue in 2025. Then issue the fiscalized invoice in January 2026 with reference to the December document. This requires careful reconciliation to avoid double taxation.

3. Split Process
Delivery/Service Date = December 2025 ‚Üí post accruals for VAT/revenue. Invoice Date = January 2026 ‚Üí fiscalized invoice submission. This way, accounting books reflect December VAT, while fiscalization compliance is maintained.
